section.name: Component Type Semantics
section.p: A number of factors related to a component implementation class impact the way in which instance of that class should be handled. These factors include:

ul.li: the component lifestyle policy - encapsulating the capability (or inability) of the implementation class to handle multiple concurrent threads of activity

the component lifecycle policy - capturing the sequencing of activities that an instance assumes during commissioning, general execution, and decommissioning (typically represented by operations such as start, suspend, resume, stop, etc.).
the component garbage collection policy - reflecting Weak, soft, and hard references maintained by a runtime controller on a given component instance
